clinical_study.brief_title: Piano Training, Caregivers, and Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Group Piano Training on Psychosocial Outcomes in Caregivers of Adults With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the impact of group piano training on psychosocial outcomes in caregivers of adults with Parkinson's disease (PD). As well, the study is investigating the impact of group piano training on psychosocial outcomes in the care-recipient with PD.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in caregiver burden as assessed by the Zarit Burden Interview.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to month 1, baseline to month 2, baseline to month 4
primary_outcome.description: The Zarit burden is a 22-item questionnaire with range from 0-88 with a higher score indicating severe burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in depression as assessed by the Center for Epidemiological Studies for Depression (CES-D).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to month 1, baseline to month 2, baseline to month 4
secondary_outcome.description: The CES-D is a 20-item questionnaire with range from 0-60 with a higher score indicating increased symptoms of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in musical self-efficacy as assessed by the Musical Performance Self-Efficacy Scale (MPSE).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to month 1, baseline to month 2, baseline to month 4
secondary_outcome.description: The MPSE is a 24 item questionnaire with range from 0-2400 with a higher score indicating improved musical self-efficacy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in mood by the Profile of Mood States - Brief Form (POMS-BF).
secondary_outcome.description: The POMS-BF is a 30 item questionnaire with six sub-scale scored on a 5-point Likert scale with a higher total score indicating increased negative mood.

arm_group.description: This group will consist of the adult with Parkinson's disease and their caregiver for a total of 14 pairs.

intervention.description: The group piano training is scheduled over 4 months of a two-hour weekly group piano lesson. There is also a 3-hour weekly practice at home.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Caregiver:
- Are currently a primary caregiver to an adult with PD
- Are between the age of 40-80 years
- Have less than 5 years of music training
- Speak and read English fluently
Adult with PD:
- Stage 1-3 Parkinson's disease
- Are between the age of 40-80
- Have less than 5 years of music training
- Speak and read English fluently
Exclusion Criteria:
- Doesn't meet all the inclusion criteria
